extendedInfo.description: Life should always be this easy, this fun and this free.Unchained from the norm, Conway's Life GL will do more than play a simple set of rules: With it you can ultimately shape your automata's destiny. Empowered with the ability to choose any and all combinations of life and death rules, we place no restraint on your exploration in the mathematical labyrinth of cellular automata.This fun app is a full featured Life Game, allowing the user to change the birth and survival rules to see the full range of two-dimensional cellular automata systems. See chaotic systems and slowly emergent systems, depending on the rules chosen. Vary colors, speed and shapes. No other Life Game implements rule setting.

reviews.title: At least the Dev responded.
reviews.comment: Things seem to have improved since the last time i used it. The touch is still inaccurate, but better than before. The annoying startup ad is gone.  One glitch is that when you pan with two fingers, occasionally it makes a few random pixels of life. Zoom could also be integrated into the two-finger gesture. *Old review: The app starts with a plea to click an ad. Random always seems to create two gliders at the exact same position. Touch controls are off by half an inch, and there is no way to zoom in or out
reviews.author: Harikrishnan R

reviews.comment: Very cool and interesting implementation of a classic game. Works perfectly on the EVO 4G. I really enjoy being able to make my own rules for the grid
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I have better versions installed
reviews.comment: Start the app, receive a plea to click an ad, simulation starts with two small designs that crawl across the screen diagonally from upper right to lower left and wrap around. I stop it and hit random. Same designs, same locations, so I get the same results. Again and again I try and that is all it produces. Lame. I had to program an implementation of this in high school in 1993. It worked better than this (granted, just about any other implementation would, however). If only I knew how to program for Android... Uninstalling. There are much better (that is to say, working) implementations of this in the Play Store.
reviews.author: Ed DeQuasie

reviews.title: Doesn\'t fit screen / sense touch properly
reviews.comment: it sets up a square grid which can\'t be changed.  My ideal game of life program would have an infinite grid (not one that wrapps) that I could zoom in and out of.  Would have rated it 3 stars if it wernt for all the wankers who don\'t know about conways game of life rating it 1 star
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fascinating and Stimulating Entertainment!
reviews.comment: Conway\'s Life is a fun and easy to use cellular life simulation. If you tweak the rules you begin to understand how each cell is birthed and how it survives, by the number of cells surrounding it. Fun to stare at while intoxicated!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I dont get this game ! How do u play it? Whats da goal? Theres NO INSTRUCTIONS!!! Sum 1 help!\tWhat am.i supposed to do & why?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Kewlest Life Game I Found!
reviews.comment: I wish I had tried this one first. Very fast, very stable, and a lot of fun!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Very nagging ads. Poor performance on galaxy s2
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great time waster
reviews.comment: Set up the rules and watch the cells evolve!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: The greatest recreation of Conway\'s game of life on the market. 5* it would be nice to change the size though, like fullscreen status.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I got mesmerized at first, then curiosity took over when I figured out how to hack the rules. I wish it was easier to set up custom pattern.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: This is an oddly addicting app. Its interesting to see what rules lead to which stable or cyclical patterns.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Immediate repeated begging.
reviews.comment: Before I could try the app I got not one, but two, full screen windows with tiny text begging me to click his ads. Immediately uninstalled.
reviews.author: A Google User
